subject: Re: For Misty  RE: [EVP-ITC] DRV - Direct Radio Voice recordings
author: Misty Dawn
full_text:
Hiya Ron

Nope didnt miss anything. Good question. Last time I was using AM frequency was somewhere around 550-580 (not digital so cant tell ya exactly where it is/was). The night before it was between 850-1000 closer to the 900 mark. Not sure whats better. I would just try a few spots where nothings coming thru but the sound of the air waves or radio hum/buzz. Thats all I heard live anyway.

I remember reading about other people getting contacts with an old tube radio and tuning to a section that it sounded like ocean waves... I didnt hear ocean waves but I guess the whooshing noise/static could be considered as such. It just wasnt a constant sound on mine as it was on theres. Just the hum of the radios power being on was the only contstant I noticed in both sessions. Perhaps why I hear nothing live but they all could?? No clue so I wont pretend to understand it anymore than the sweep files I get. They did voice having some difficulty on the lower freq.

Misty

--- On Sun, 8/31/08, Ron Lederer <ronriko@...> wrote:

> From: Ron Lederer <ronriko@...>
> Subject: For Misty  RE: [EVP-ITC] DRV - Direct Radio Voice recordings
> To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
> Date: Sunday, August 31, 2008, 10:30 AM
> Hi Misty    Maybe I missed it but can u tell me what
> radio, am or fm, and radio frequency you tuned to more or
> less?  Probably the best stations I can get here are the
> non-stations.  lol  ron
> 
> --- On Sat, 8/30/08, Misty Dawn
> <bulletbabea@...> wrote:
> 
> From: Misty Dawn <bulletbabea@...>
> Subject: RE: [EVP-ITC] DRV - Direct Radio Voice recordings
> To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
> Date: Saturday, August 30, 2008, 8:29 PM
> 
> 
> 
> 
> 
> 
> I never had alot of luck with it either. I tried it before
> with group many times but it was so distant and never clear
> or just nothing at all. But every now and then when I do a
> manual sweep I notice while I sit on dead air that sometimes
> thats where the best evp would come thru so I started to
> make it a habit that when I start and stop my sweep sessions
> its off station in the dead zone. I was doing a sweep the
> other night and they came thru real clear there with
> messages for my friend so I thought hmmm lets try just DRV
> and no sweeping and see if they can connect or if I can hear
> them. I heard nothing live just buzzing noise or what sounds
> like air/waves/whooshing now and then. So its not like some
> get where they hear it loud and clear and have conversations
> back and forth. At least not yet.
> 
> Maybe a few adjustments could change that I dont know. I
> never know why some days they are clearer than others.
> 
> Misty
>
